meanings.definition: A project that is part of a larger project.
meanings.sent1: The science fair poster was my subproject for the school project.
meanings.sent2: The construction of the playground was a subproject within the city's renovation plan.
meanings.sent3: For the baking contest, my subproject was to perfect the chocolate chip cookie recipe.
meanings.sent4: Her role in the play was like a subproject, adding depth to the overall performance.
meanings.sent5: The subproject of creating a new logo brought fresh ideas to the company's branding.

meanings.definition: To divide a project into smaller parts.
meanings.sent1: I will subproject the research paper into sections for easier management.
meanings.sent2: The team decided to subproject the event planning to ensure efficiency.
meanings.sent3: She likes to subproject her cleaning tasks to tackle them one at a time.
meanings.sent4: The artist will subproject the mural design to focus on each detail.
meanings.sent5: To complete the assignment on time, it is important to subproject the workload effectively.
